ADNOC signs 15-year LNG supply deal with IndianOilADNOC announced a 15-year Sales and Purchase Agreement (SPA) with Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (IndianOil), India’s largest integrated energy company, for the supply of one million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of liquefied natural gas (LNG). The gas will be sourced primarily from ADNOC’s lower-carbon Ruwais LNG project.

PetroChina Proposes Buying Gas Companies for $5.6 BillionPetroChina Co. has proposed buying three natural gas storage companies for 40 billion yuan ($5.6 billion) to bolster the nation’s infrastructure for the fuel.

South Korea Kicks Off US Deals Bonanza After Trump, Lee MeetSouth Korean firms announced a flurry of deals with US businesses, including $50 billion in agreements with Boeing Co. and GE Aerospace, after the nations’ leaders met in-person for the first time in Washington on Monday.

Powering inclusive growth and energy security in Namibia and beyondIn a thought leadership piece for Energy Connects ahead of Global African Hydrogen Summit, Hafeni Motsi, Acting Senior Manager, Investment Analysis and Development at Namibia Investment Promotion and Development, explains how green hydrogen, produced from Africa’s abundant renewable resources, is emerging as a driver of inclusive growth, energy security, and industrial transformation — creating jobs, boosting self-reliance, and positioning countries like Namibia, Mauritania, Morocco, and South Africa as global leaders in a sustainable hydrogen economy.Thought Leadership
